page.title: 07CHANGING FACE OF TOURISM
page.content: In the early 1900's the majority of "tourists" came from Portsmouth. They came in groups by boat or road to spend a day at the castle. Portchester, at this time, was mainly farmland and market gardens. Castle Street was flourishing, with six Pubs to cope with the influx of visitors, but only two, The Cormorant and The White Hart now remain. Nowadays Castle Street tolerates, rather than welcomes, the tourists. The majority of visitors still come from the surrounding area but an increasing number are foreigners. The welfare of Portchester as a town has never relied heavily on the tourist industry, and it is only in recent years that the history of Portchester has attracted any great outside interest.
